programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The competition is fierce, and as the barbecues are fired up all 8 chefs are feeling the heat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Each chef is giving everything they've got and there are three completely new desserts in competition today.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The winning chefs must now cook their dishes at the grand finale, the 'Taste of Summer' banquet

programme.title: Great British Food Revival
programme.sub-title: Michel Roux jr on Bread / Hairy Bikers on Cauliflower
programme.desc: Michel Roux Jr gets passionate about the lost art of baking bread. He sets out to discover the secrets behind artisan bread and shares his own recipes and The Hairy Bikers bang the drum for the revival of the British cauliflower.

programme.title: Great British Food Revival
programme.sub-title: James Martin on Apples / Matt Tebbutt on Mutton
programme.desc: Chef and proud Yorkshireman James Martin takes on the challenge of reviving the British apple and Matt Tebutt leads the charge on behalf of mutton.

programme.title: Great British Food Revival
programme.sub-title: Ainsley Harriott on Honey / Glynn Purnell on Cheese
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott shows off his sweet side as he starts a campaign for the revival of British honey and Michelin starred chef and Great British Menu favourite Glynn Purnell rides to the rescue of British cheese.

programme.title: Great British Food Revival
programme.sub-title: Gary Rhodes on Tomatoes / Angela Hartnett on Crab
programme.desc: Gary Rhodes wants us all to appreciate the virtues of the British tomato and Michelin-starred chef Angela Hartnett attempts to find her sea legs when she delves into why crab is so unloved in Britain.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Great British Menu is back and the fight is on as the nations greatest chefs battle for the chance to cook a glittering Olympic Banquet. Its the battle of the Scottish chefs returning chef Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs - Alan Murchison, Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be Grilled Mackerel with beetroot meringues and horseradish ice cream; Crab cannelloni or poached halibut with squid ink?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the battle of the Scottish chefs Alan Murchison, Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway. Today is the big one, the main course, but which one will get top marks?
